title: Ticket #1447: dedicated scheduler doesn't check concurrency limits for claim reuse
description:
When the dedicated scheduler considers an unexpired claim for re-use, it does not check that concurrency limits also match between job ad and the claimed resource.

The repro below assumes a two-slot dedicated scheduler configuration, with: 

TEST_LIMIT = 4

In the following repro example, the second job should not be able to re-use the claim from the first job, however it does: 

% echo -e 'universe=parallel\ncmd=/bin/sleep\nargs=20s\nmachine_count=2\nconcurrency_limits=TEST:1\nqueue\n' | condor_submit
% echo -e 'universe=parallel\ncmd=/bin/sleep\nargs=20s\nmachine_count=2\nconcurrency_limits=TEST:2\nqueue\n' | condor_submit

It isn't required, but I also found it helpful to make claim timeout faster for testing: 

UNUSED_CLAIM_TIMEOUT = 30
